confession.seduction_context: She was very sad because she had young children to support, and was too poor to do so with wheat at 30 francs the resal. Bewailing this in garden one evening when she was approached by Parsin, who promised to help her so she would no longer be in need.

witnesses.name: Jehenne veuve Honn homme Claude Brabant

testimony.quarrel_subject: Marie's husband refused grain to Claude Brabant
Witness would not marry Marie's son Nicolas

harms_alleged.target: mother of witness (widow of Joseph Marchand)

witnesses.name: Mongeatte femme Honneste Homme Nicolas Huel

testimony.threat_quote: her husband would see what he gained

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day after St Martin visit
after asking for money during Lent

testimony.quarrel_subject: Witness's husband and son-in-law had quarrel with Marie's son, who was in same trade as son-in-law, and beat him up
Daughter of accused was working in house sewing; became angry about rocking the child
testimony.threat_quote: she would not do this much longer

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after; died next day after Marie's visit

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrel between her brother and son-in-law of accused
testimony.threat_quote: she or the devil would have her
they would not keep it long (referring to horse)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Son Colas had been apprentice as blacksmith but left before expiry of contract
Marie's daughter had dispute with his wife; Marie made threats about those who had taken part in play in town
Mother quarrelled with daughter of accused
Hated her father over business he transacted as tabellion and refusal of grain

timeline.subject: Marie femme Gabriel Ozelle

timeline.subject: Marie femme Gabriel Ozelle
timeline.details: Death sentence from Change de Nancy; to be strangled after feeling fire

harms_catalog.harm_description: Strange illness that lasted a long time; vomited up some 50 little creatures

Jehenne veuve Honn homme Claude Brabant, tabellion
witness was with her mother (widow of Joseph Marchand)
Mongeatte femme Honneste Homme Nicolas Huel
Barbon femme Mre Pierre Barbas, chirurgien
her mother, wife of Joseph Marchant

notable_quotes.speaker: son-in-law of Marie
notable_quotes.french: qu'il n'y pouvoit empescher, qu'il scavoit bien que ce n'estoit pas grand chose, qu'elle avoit faict desesperer sa mere de Blamont
notable_quotes.context: Reply when warned not to kill any more animals

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie femme Gabriel Ozelle
notable_quotes.context: Expressing regret during confession under torture

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie femme Gabriel Ozelle
notable_quotes.context: Referring to the devil who promised to help her resist torture

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie femme Gabriel Ozelle
notable_quotes.french: neanmoins elle n'eust le pouvoir sur elle, et ne devient aucunement malade
notable_quotes.english: nevertheless she had no power over her, and she did not become sick at all
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why her attempt to kill daughter-in-law failed

third_parties.name: Nicolas Bernard

material_culture.context: Multiple disputes over refusal to provide grain
Wheat at 30 francs the resal when Marie was seduced; refusal to sell wheat to Marie
Daughter of accused asked for wine, refused on grounds of quarrel
Quarrel over hay between witness 8 and Marie
Lucas Mongin le viel refused Marie's husband a horseshoe (both were smiths)
Women at hospital refused to help Marie with washtub
Marie gave Pierre an apple at the mill, after which he became ill
Marie threw ashes from fire over stomach of dying child and around cradle
Black powder to kill, white powder to heal; given by devil
Devil gave her money which turned out to be leaves
Had given devil a chicken every year so she did not have to go to sabbat so often

spatial_references.context: Location of trial and residence of accused
Son-in-law mentioned Marie had made his mother from Blamont despair
Witness washing laundry in river when Marie passed behind her and she fell in
Where Marie was bewailing poverty when approached by devil
Marie touched witness on arm in market
Where Marie gave Pierre an apple
Where Sebille and Jennon lived who refused to help with washtub
Marie went into stable on pretext of looking for grandson; ox died next day

historical_context.military_details: Marie said 17 or 18 years before had been very angry with present husband for not doing enough to feed them in time of war
economic_hardship_indicators: Wheat at 30 francs the resal during Marie's seduction
Too poor to support young children
Husband went drinking without regard for family when grain was costly

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over grain and wheat; business transaction as tabellion mentioned; dispute over land deals; apprenticeship contract dispute; Marie described as very poor, unable to support children during high grain prices

change_de_nancy.modification_details: to be strangled after feeling fire

hearsay_chains.content: 15 or 16 children stillborn over previous year

emotional_state_notes: Expressed great regret at being 'so poorly tempted and abused'
Said she prayed to God, Virgin, and St Anne for help in resisting devil's demands

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial shows extensive testimony with multiple accusations spanning 25+ years. Marie confessed under torture to multiple killings including her first husband, daughter, and various community members. Economic hardship and wartime context clearly mentioned. Change de Nancy modified sentence to include 'feeling fire' before strangulation.
